alert.note: Alert for Pembina; Walsh (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 05 at 10:32AM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Two Rivers River near Hallock affecting Kittson County. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Kittson and Pembina Counties. Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Marshall, Kittson, Walsh and Pembina Counties. .The first flood wave of the spring season has now passed across the international border into Canada with the Red River at Pembina recently cresting. However, renewed rises are expected in the coming days at some locations on the Red and on the Minnesota tributaries (especially in southern portions of the basin). This is due to the weather system currently impacting the region bringing rain, snow, and some mixed precipitation. Note that these river forecasts incorporate the precipitation that has recently occurred in addition to forecast precipitation through 7 am Wednesday. Therefore, river forecasts will likely continue to change in the coming days as the total precipitation from this system is worked into the river forecasts. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Red River of the North at Drayton. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 34.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Tuesday was 35.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 32.5 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 32.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
